repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This is a base implementation of `nvim_api_get_doc` for getting the api documentation generated in `runtime/doc/api.mpack` by `scripts/gen_vimdoc.py`. Help, feedback, additions, etc. are appreciated. 

One question: should this PR add a spec for `nvim_api_get_doc` as well? I assume so, but I figured I'd ask before creating one.

cc: @bfredl

comment_data.body: checking in the mpack file is a bit unfortunate but I suppose it avoids adding python as a build dependency?
`gen_api_dispatch.lua` needs access to that file, so yeah, would probably have to have python if I didnâ€™t check in the mpack file, so that it could be generated first.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,9 +8,11 @@ if arg[1] == '--help' then
   print('      3: functions metadata output file (funcs_metadata.generated.h)')
   print('      4: API metadata output file (api_metadata.mpack)')
   print('      5: lua C bindings output file (msgpack_lua_c_bindings.generated.c)')
+  print('      6: api docs metadata output file (api_doc_metadata.generated.h)')
+  print('      7: api docs msgpack file path (api.mpack)')
   print('      rest: C files where API functions are defined')
 end
-assert(#arg >= 4)
+assert(#arg >= 5)

comment_data.body: Turn it to 7 and see what happens (it seems reasonable, yes)

comment_data.body: Just to verify, is this correct?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,13 +30,15 @@ local funcs_metadata_outputf = arg[3]
 local mpack_outputf = arg[4]
 local lua_c_bindings_outputf = arg[5]
 
+local api_doc_metadata_outpuf = arg[6]
+
 -- set of function names, used to detect duplicates
 local function_names = {}
 
 local c_grammar = require('generators.c_grammar')
 
 -- read each input file, parse and append to the api metadata
-for i = 6, #arg do
+for i = 8, #arg do

comment_data.body: I could do `packed = ...` here but I changed it to `api_packed` because I wasn't sure if reusing the `packed` variable should be avoided?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,6 +168,15 @@ local dump_bin_array = require("generators.dump_bin_array")
 dump_bin_array(funcs_metadata_output, 'funcs_metadata', packed)
 funcs_metadata_output:close()
 
+
+local api_doc_metadata_output = io.open(api_doc_metadata_outpuf, 'wb')
+local api_mpack = io.open(arg[7], 'r')
+local api_packed = mpack.pack(api_mpack:read('*all'))

comment_data.body: `"api_functions"` is good or should that be changed?

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,6 +168,15 @@ local dump_bin_array = require("generators.dump_bin_array")
 dump_bin_array(funcs_metadata_output, 'funcs_metadata', packed)
 funcs_metadata_output:close()

+local api_mpack = io.open(arg[7], 'r')
+local api_packed = mpack.pack(api_mpack:read('*all'))

comment_data.body:
was hoping to instead introduce `nvim_get_api` which will deprecate `nvim_get_api_info`.

    nvim_get_api(Dict options)

works like the old `nvim_get_api_info`, except:

- `options.doc = true` (default=false) includes docstrings with the API metadata 
- the `functions` and `ui_events` elements are maps instead of a list
  - feel free to make this a TODO for this PR, if you don't want to do it

I have no idea why, but this doesn't work at all. Running the following Lua code:
```lua
local info = vim.api.nvim_get_api {
  docs = true
}

for k, _ in pairs(info) do
  print(k)
end
```
`info` should contain the docs and thus `docstrings` should be one of the keys printed, but it isn't even in the table: no docstrings. That makes no sense to me, because I did some logging in `nvim_get_api` that confirmed that `api_metadata` _is_ getting a `true` value. What am I missing?
because of static initialization `static Dictionary metadata`
i e you need to run `init_docs_metadata(&metadata)` and add to the dict _after_ `copy_dictionary`

This is just so I can assume further down that there's only one key, and so don't have to iterate over the dictionary but can just get `opts.items[0]`; I could do a `for` loop though like in `nvim_get_context` if that's preferred?

You could just replace `if (opts.size > 0) {` with the for loop header (one line) and then remove this check tho. it is also more consistent with other single-opt functions and easier to extend later.

comment_regular_data.body: Hey, I think this would be cool -- do you still want to do this @smolck ?
Should add a test verifies we can at least get the dict.
I apologize if this is obvious, but where should the test go?

hmmm... Probably somewhere like `./test/functional/api/doc_spec.lua` (new file). That follows the general structure there I think.

Also, maybe we change the name to `nvim_doc_get_api()` or something like that? Since we usually do `nvim_<namespace>_<function>` and we may add other doc functoins in the future?

What are your thoughts?

> hmmm... Probably somewhere like `./test/functional/api/doc_spec.lua` (new file). That follows the general structure there I think.

Okay, thanks! I'll check out some of the other tests and hopefully come up with something ;)

> Also, maybe we change the name to `nvim_doc_get_api()` or something like that? Since we usually do `nvim_<namespace>_<function>` and we may add other doc functoins in the future?

Hmm I'm not sure, I might have to think about that a bit. I think starting with `nvim_doc_` makes more sense than w/`nvim_api_` but I'm not so sure about the `get_api` part. Not really sure of a good alternative name though.

As a bit of an aside, I'm curious; what sort of other doc functions do you think would be added in the future?
`nvim_doc_get_lua`, `nvim_do_get_doxygen`, idk maybe more? :) I think just think it's a better namespace though.

So I think this is about done? Definitely ready for review; only things I haven't done of [justinmk's suggestions above](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/12040#discussion_r471238315) are making `functions` and `ui_events` maps instead of lists (I'll save that as a TODO for a future PR) and deprecating `nvim_get_api_info` (kind of unsure how to go about that or if that should even be done in this PR, etc.?).

Thanks @smolck for the effort here. 

I think we should skip this because:

- Reading msgpack data is well-supported in Lua, thus easy from the API also (`nvim_exec_lua`).
    - We need to better document `runtime/doc/api.mpack` and related `doc/*.mpack` files, I'll do that.
- `_meta/*.lua` now provides annotations for API, Vimscript functions, etc.

title: feat(api): nvim_get_api_doc
